SENT.plain: OBJECTIVE: To determine the prevalence of dementia in Thai people with age 45 years and above
MATERIAL AND METHOD: This project used a cross sectional research design to study the prevalence of dementia in Chiang Mai
Door-to-door technique was assigned in condition with multi-stage probability random sampling to obtain subjects representing the population of Chiang Mai between Oct 2004 and Sep 2005
The researchers collected the data from the subjects aged 45 years and above
All subjects were located from every Amphurs of Chiang Mai
They were first screened with Thai Mini Mental State Examination (TMSE) and Thai Beck Depression Inventory (BDI)
The subjects whose TMSE was less than 24 were assessed and diagnosed by a neurologist
Subjects who were determined as having dementia might be laboratory analyzed and classified based on DSM-IV and NINDS-AIREN criteria
RESULTS: The authors enrolled 2,311 people and screened them with Batteries test
One thousand four hundred ninety two people qualified with 610 males and 882 females, whose mean age was 59.7 +/- 10.4 years
The authors found that among the 35 people with dementia, the mean age was 67.9 +/- 8.9 years (45-88 years)
The prevalence of dementia among the study participants was 2.35%
In the present study, Alzheimer's disease was the most common type of dementia diagnosed (75.0%) and vascular dementia was the second most commonly diagnosed (12.5%)
CONCLUSION: The prevalence of dementia in Chiang Mai was 2.35%, which does not differ from the previous study Alzheimer's disease was the most common type of dementia diagnosed
